H0.text: What country, after having governed it for 155 years, transferred its sovereignty of Hong Kong to China in 1997. Portugal

H1.text: What country, after having governed it for 155 years, transferred its sovereignty of Hong Kong to China in 1997. France

H2.text: What country, after having governed it for 155 years, transferred its sovereignty of Hong Kong to China in 1997. Netherlands

H3.text: What country, after having governed it for 155 years, transferred its sovereignty of Hong Kong to China in 1997. Uk

A4.text: The handover of Hong Kong from the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland to the People's Republic of China occurred at midnight on 1 July 1997.

A5.text: The United Kingdom obtained control over portions of Hong Kong's territory through three treaties concluded with Qing China after the Opium Wars: 1842 Treaty of Nanking: Hong Kong Island ceded in perpetuity

A6.text: The United Kingdom obtained control over portions of Hong Kong's territory through three treaties concluded with Qing China after the Opium Wars: 1842 Treaty of Nanking: Hong Kong Island ceded in perpetuity; 1860 Treaty of Peking: Kowloon ceded; 1898 lease of New Territories for 99 years

A7.text: The United Kingdom transferred control of Hong Kong and surrounding territories to the People's Republic of China.
